page.title: 10OLD PEOPLE IN WADDINGTON
page.content: There is a high proportion of older people in Upper Waddington. They prefer to live there rather than Lower Waddington because it is peaceful, friendly and near to the countryside. Many retired members of the R.A.F. live there. There are several clubs which older people might join, such as the Bowls Club, the Gardeners Club and the Sunshine Club. The Sunshine Club meet twice per month. They show movies, organise excursions and hold parties on peoples' birthdays. At Easter they have an Easter bonnet parade. The steep hill causes some problems in moving freely between upper and lower Waddington for some old people, though there are three fairly good bus services into Lincoln.
